intro: Crepidiastrum ameristophyllum, commonly known as the American starleaf, is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves that are often adorned with distinctive star-shaped markings. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in cyathia, typical of the spurge family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or wetland habitats. Its foliage and floral structures are important for attracting pollinators and supporting local biodiversity.
